info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 12 at 5:59PM CDT until June 13 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MDT FOR NORTHERN SCOTTS BLUFF AND SOUTHEASTERN SIOUX COUNTIES... At 459 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mitchell, or 11 miles northwest of Scottsbluff, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Scottsbluff, Gering, Mitchell, Terrytown, Morrill, Lake Minatare Campground, Hubbard Hill, Stegall, Scottsbluff Airport, Lake Minatare, Scotts Bluff National Monument and Lake Alice. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne. This thunderstorm is capable of producing all types of severe weather including extremely large hail, destructive straight line winds and tornadoes. Move quickly to a safe shelter, such as an interior room, a bathroom or closet or basement.
